snippet: The police in Abuja, the capital, said Monday that they had banned protests organized to demand that the government rescue more than 200 girls still held captive by Boko Haram militants.
abstract: Police in Abuja, Nigeria, say they have banned protests organized to demand that the government rescue the more than 200 girls still held captive by Boko Haram militants.
lead_paragraph: The police in Abuja, the capital, said Monday that they had banned protests organized to demand that the government rescue more than 200 girls still held captive by Boko Haram militants.

headline.main: Protests in Nigeria Over Captives Banned
